What kind of transactions does Verus support, and what makes them private?

Verus supports provably zero-knowledge transactions, which means that the sender, receiver, and amount of the transaction are mathematically, provably private. These transactions can also include encrypted messages.

The VerusHash mining algorithm is built to provide a solution to the current ASIC situation in crypto. Not only is it the fastest CPU mining algorithm in the world right now, but because of the fact that it leverages extreme integration in modern day processors, effectively treating their internals as mini, high speed ASICs, it allows people to mine easily from their laptop or PC and actually earn as much VRSC for their investment as even big miners, because they aren’t competing with specialized, purpose-built machines or on an algorithm where GPUs have a major advantage. — @MikeToutonghi

What is the VerusHash mining algorithm, and what makes it unique?

The VerusHash mining algorithm is designed to provide a solution to the current ASIC situation in crypto. It is the fastest CPU mining algorithm in the world, and it leverages extreme integration in modern processors, effectively treating their internals as mini, high-speed ASICs. This allows individuals to mine easily from their laptop or PC and earn a significant amount of VRSC, without competing with specialized, purpose-built machines or on an algorithm where GPUs have a major advantage.

How were mining and staking rewards handled in the early days of Verus, and how will they be handled in the future?

From the beginning, all mining and staking rewards equal to or over 192 Verus were time-locked for release and first use randomly over the next 25 months. In the future, after the next halving where rewards halve to 96 Verus, they will not be time-locked and will be available for staking or trading within 100 blocks from being staked or mined.

What is the current phase of the Verus project, and what are the future phases?

The current phase of the Verus project is Phase One, which has already been delivered and includes the mainnet, 50/50 PoW/PoS, time locks, and fair launch. The future phases are Phase Two, which includes autochains, polls, and Verus Mobile; Phase Three, which includes identity and proof of virtue; and Phase Four, which includes integrated machine learning, content, and storage.
